title: Value of the derivative of a composite function

content.question: If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41A6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>,</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41C6@</annotation> </semantics> </math> then the derivative of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F40@</annotation> </semantics> </math> at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@3BBB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
